page.title: 10Farming 4 - Llwynycelyn
page.content:
There are 2 main shooting rules: No shooting on Sundays or Christmas day. A white pheasant must not be killed
The keeper incubates the pheasants' eggs for exactly 24 days. This way far more eggs are hatched. In the old days brooding hens would sit on them but this method was unreliable. When the pheasants are hatched the are put into a heated hut with as much food and water as they want for one week. After this they are let out into the open, with a net over the pen to prevent escape. Each week they are transferred into a larger pen as they need more room as they get bigger. After 9 weeks they are released into the woods. There are on average, 2000 pheasants at Llwynycelyn at all times of ther year.
